hackathon-description-text: HackNEU 2017 is an inaugaral hackathon for students at Northeastern University.
hackathon-eligibility:
To attend this event you need be graduate or PHD students at Northeastern University.
Age: 18+
Max Team Size : 4 people (You can create teams after you register as well)
hackathon-requirements: Please submit following details in order to consider for valid submission:
hackathon-rules:
For Spring 2017 HackNEU Hackathon session only Graduate and PHD students and alumni of Northeastern University are allowed to participate.
Teams have full ownership of projects created during the Hackathon event.
Teams may consist of 1-4 members. All members need to register individually.
You must demo your hack in order to present. No slide-decks or PowerPoint will be allowed. Time limit for presentations 4 min.
You must abide by the 
. We have a zero-tolerance policy for harassment. If you’re making others feel unsafe in anyway, you will be disqualified and removed from the event. End of story.
For this Hackathon session participants are required to login to 
and submit project wise details for challenge/prize consideration by judges.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One team will get this reward
One team will get this reward
One team will get this reward

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How impactful will this solution be for its target audience?
How well designed is this solution, from front end through to UI/UX?
How well executed is this solution from start to finish?

Additional points:
Do you have a business and marketing model for the project?
Is your project creating a social impact?
